text: Fredric Ruff Jameson (April 14, 1934 â€“ September 22, 2024) was an American literary critic, philosopher and Marxist political theorist. He was best known for his analysis of contemporary cultural trends. Jameson's best-known books include Postmodernism, or, The Cultural Logic of Late Capitalism (1991) and The Political Unconscious (1981). Jameson was born in Cleveland, Ohio. He studied at Haverford College and Yale University. Jameson was a professor at Duke University. Jameson died at his home in Killingworth, Connecticut on September 22, 2024, at the age of 90. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2024 deaths Category:American critics Category:American philosophers Category:Educators from Cleveland Category:Writers from Cleveland Category:Educators from North Carolina Category:Writers from North Carolina Category:People from Durham, North Carolina
title: Fredric Jameson
